Posts.Content: Sphynx wrote: We'd love to have you join our team "Wings of Hope" at the Detroit Race for the Cure. We have 41+ members so far! Team Registration closes May 29th at 9:00 a.m. for the reduced entry fee of $25.00! We want our Canadian friends to join us again! Barb, Tina and Shel....You are closer to Detroit than most of us! Where is "our" 3Bears family - Michelle? We'd love to have you and your wonderful family join us again! Advantages of joining our team: I'll pick up your t-shirt and get it to you before the race or the morning of the race. Save on postage. Reduced sign-up amount. Get to be a part of a great team that is already up to 41 people! We are close to being the team with the most survivors. If you cannot walk you can take the trolley which has "trolley goodies"and a bird's eye view of everything. Some members are actually running! It is very inspirational to see them run by and to cheer them on. Did I mention what a great team we have? We have members joining as far as Ohio, Illinois and Arizona and after I twist those arms, Canada! We get to take a team picture. We get to meet our new friends from bc.org We plan to meet afterwards for lunch and kick back and have more fun. One of the links to sign up: http://www.karmanos.org/detroitraceforthecure/index.asp Dx 2/28/2003, Stage II, Grade 3, 1/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Near Detroit, Canada, Ohio, Illinois.....??? Sphynx Not_Me

Posts.Content: May 6, 2009 01:49PM - edited May 6, 2009 03:48PM by Sphynx I just posted this on another topic but I thought it would go here also.  Six years out for me so I put together a little photo montage of old pics. The first picture is 4 months growth, thick and curly. I ditched the wig at 2 months out. The second is about 9 months and I didn't know what to do with those curls and bangs. Tried being a blond. The third is 2 years and it is still thick, long and curly but less so. Loved that year. The last is current - back to natural color, very thin and fine and exactly like it was before chemo - sigh! I used nioxin shampoo back then. Editted since I noticed that the third picture was taken at a bc.org get-together in 2/2005. (not 2006)
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 7, 2009 07:17PM Sphynx wrote: Judy - good to hear from you. You are almost half-way done! How are you handling chemo? Your picture is great. My lashes and brows fell out late and came back quickly. Unfortunately, the lashes fell out a few more times way after chemo. Everything is back to normal now. I know it's frustrating but, I haven't heard of anyone not growing their hair back after chemo. Some just grow really slow. I don't think I did anything special to make it grow fast. I shaved my head when it was falling out. When the baby downy hair grew in, I shaved that off also. It is wonderfully soft but didn't feel like real hair. It's some kind of tease of nature. That was the only time I've ever had thick hair. Now it's very thin. Don't forget to take advantage of the 'Look Good, Feel Better' program for your area. Tons of free makeup! http://www.lookgoodfeelbetter.org/women/program_finder/ Jane - I'm not sure but I'm sure someone else will know. Nancy
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 6, 2009 02:44PM Sphynx wrote: kmmd - My hair grew like a weed.  I wore a wig to work throughout chemo and ditched it after 2 months after completely shaving off the chemo baby fuzz hair.  I went bare at home.  I think it still is growing very fast (about an inch a month) but I wish I could thicken it up.  I'm taking biotin but maybe I should try the nioxin again?  My eyebrows never grew in that great but the lashes came in nicely.  One funny thing is that I never completely lost my arm hair. When my hair grew back, I look like a monkey with so much arm hair.  I still have the face fuzz that I think you can see in the first picture.  I could do without that. Whether it grows slow or fast, it does come back!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 24, 2009 06:38AM Sphynx wrote: I have to borrow that term "amazon arm hair".  I never lost my arm hair either, Jaimieh and it came back like a monkey!  The facial hair - it's just cruel.  Back when I was going through this, everyone assured me that the facial hair would go away.  Well, I was the anomaly.  But, the hair on my head did come back thicker than I ever had hair in my life.  I noticed that many of you are watching the growth of that baby duck hair that first comes in.  I didn't consider that real hair and shaved it off!  I know, that's hard but it would be harder waiting for the baby fuzz to go away and have the real thick stuff come in.   Of course, this is just my experience!  Not exactly scientific. I put pictures back on page 60.  Six years out, my hair is exactly like it was before, THIN!  It was nice while it lasted.   Don't get discouraged you guys.  It just takes time and the best part is we are around to talk about it.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2009 06:39AM Sphynx wrote: I feel very fortunate to have met Deb when she was in Michigan.  She touched everyone around her and she will be greatly missed.  I'm at work and I need to get it together and stop the tears.  My heart goes out to her family.  Deb is in the arms of the angel. Nancy
